# Specification: Subscription Upgrades

## Editor

There should be a module in the editor with:

- Name: "Subscription Upgrades"
- Icon: Repeat Order
- Default status: disabled
- Settings:
  - "Prevent downgrades"
    - Help text: "If enabled, customers will not be allowed to downgrade from a subscription to one-time purchase. Caution: this may increase cart abandonment."
    - Type: checkbox
    - Default: disabled

## Cart

> If the subscription upgrades module is disabled in the editor, the cart should skip all subscription upgrade functionality.
>
> The following cart specification is applicable only if the subscription upgrades module has been enabled in the editor.

### Behaviour

The cart frontend for subscription upgrades should be isolated to an area below each line item. This area can include content, or can be omitted if there is nothing to show. If the area includes content, then the area should have:

- Public CSS class: `.upcart-subscription-upgrade-section`
- Styling: full-width of line item

The content of each subscription upgrade area should be independent of the content for the subscription areas for any other line items.

The content of the subscription upgrade area should be as follows:

A. For **one-time purchase** line items:

- If the item cannot be sold as a subscription, nothing should be shown.
- If the item can be sold as a subscription:
  - There should be a button with:
    - Content: "Upgrade to \_\_\_\_", where \_\_\_\_ is the name of the first selling plan group for the item
    - When clicked:
      1. Show a loading spinner instead of text, and disable the button
      2. Change the item to be a subscription with the first selling plan of the first selling plan group. The line item should have the property `__upcartSubscriptionUpgrade: "true"`
    - Styling: full width of area, match to other buttons in cart
    - Public CSS class: `.upcart-subscription-upgrade-button`

B. For **subscription** line items:

- There should be a dropdown with:
  - Content: the name of the current selling plan
  - Options:
    - (OPTIONAL) A group with:
      - Title: "Full price"
      - Options:
        - "One-time purchase"
      - Condition: this group should be included if the "Prevent downgrades" setting is disabled AND the item does not _require_ a selling plan (i.e., it can be sold as a one-time purchase)
    - A group for each possible selling plan group for the item with:
      - Title: the name of the selling plan group
      - Options: the names of the possible selling plans in the group for the item
  - When selected:
    1. Show a loading spinner overlayed on the dropdown and disable the dropdown
    2. Change the selling plan of the item to the selected selling plan. If "One-time only" was selected, then remove the selling plan from the item to change it to a one-time purchase. The line item should have the property `__upcartSubscriptionEdit: "true"`
  - Styling: full width of area, match to other dropdowns in cart
  - Public CSS class: `.upcart-subscription-upgrade-dropdown`

When the current purchase option for a line item changes, the content of the subscription upgrade area should be updated to match the new purchase option.

### Edge Cases and Clarifications

- The content of the subscription upgrade area does not depend on _how_ the purchase option was selected. For example, the subscription upgrade area content for an item that was added to the cart as a subscription should be the same as the content for an item that was upgraded from a one-time purchase to a subscription in-cart.
- When selling plans are being loaded for a product, there should be no content in the subscription upgrade area. Before the selling plans are loaded, we can't fully decide what content to show so it's fine to show nothing.
- When the selling plan of an item is changed, the quantity of the item should remain constant. If you don't provide a quantity to the AJAX API when changing a line item, then the quantity of the line item will be set to 1 which should be avoided.
- Selling plans that do not apply to the selected variant for a line item should be ignored. It is possible to have selling plans that apply only to specific variants of a product. In cases where none of the selling plans from a selling plan group apply to the variant for the line item, the selling plan group should be ignored. An ignored group should not be listed in the dropdown (because it would be an empty section) and it should not be used for text of the upgrade button (because it would have no selling plan to select).

--- id: 3vst4bcr title: Discount Codes Module file_version: 1.1.3 app_version: 1.18.31 --- # Required background information ## Discount types There are two types of discounts: **automatic discounts** and **discount codes**. - **Automatic discounts** are applied to a cart or checkout automatically when the discount criteria are met. - **Discount codes** must be manually typed in by the customer. They stay active until the customer either removes the code, enters a different conflicting discount code, or changes their cart/checkout so that the discount is not longer applicable. This module is specifically for **discount codes**. We do not have to worry about **automatic discounts** because they will work in the cart by default and they do not require any user interaction. ## Discount targets A discount can be used to reduce the cost of **product(s)**, **order**, or **shipping**. - **Product discounts** reduce the price of one or more products and are shown as a reduction on individual line items. - **Order discounts** reduce the price of the order as a whole and are shown as a reduction on the overal price. - **Shipping discounts** reduce the price of shipping. # Read and write discount codes ## Read discount codes We read discount codes using the `cart.js` Ajax API endpoint. An applied discount code will be returned from the API as part of either the `cart_level_discount_applications` or the `line_level_discount_allocations`. The `cart_level_discount_applications` are for order discounts and the `line_level_discount_allocations` are for product discounts. These discount applications will include both **automatic discounts** and **discount codes**. We can distinguish between these using the `type` field of the `DiscountApplication`. ## Apply a discount code
We apply a discount code by making a request from the storefront to the route `discount/${discountCodeEncoded}`. The `discount/${discountCodeEncoded}` route is intended by Shopify to be used for [shareable discount links](https://help.shopify.com/en/manual/discounts/managing-discount-codes#promote-a-discount-using-a-shareable-link). Normally a customer would navigate to the link directly in their browser and would be redirected to the storefront. We are using it in a non-standard way by making a background network request. ### 📄 web/storefront/src/platform/online-store/discounts/discounts.ts ```typescript 23 await fetch(`${getShopifyRoutesRoot()}discount/${discountCodeEncoded}`); ```
After applying a discount code, we refetch the cart to check if the discount was successfully applied and to show updated prices. ### 📄 web/storefront/src/modules/CartPopup/DiscountCodeModule/DiscountCodeModule.tsx ```tsx 23 await platform.discounts.attemptApplyDiscountCode({ discountCode: discountCodeToApply }); 24 const updatedCart = await refetchCart(); 25 26 const discountApplications = getAllUniqueDiscountApplications(updatedCart); 27 const isValid = discountApplications.some( 28 (discountApplication) => discountApplication.title === discountCodeToApply, 29 ); ```
## Remove a discount code
We remove a discount code by applying a fake invalid discount code. There is no native way to remove discount codes so this is a workaround. This behaviour relies on the fact that there can only be one discount code applied in the cart. We are replacing the one allowed discount code with an invalid code. ### 📄 web/storefront/src/platform/online-store/discounts/discounts.ts ```typescript 14 async removeDiscountCode(): Promise { 15 const FAKE_INVALID_DISCOUNT_CODE = '~!~!UPCART_REMOVE_DISCOUNT!~!~'; 16 await this.UNSAFE_POSSIBLE_NO_OP_applyDiscountCodeAndSetShopifyCookie({ discountCode: FAKE_INVALID_DISCOUNT_CODE }); 17 } ```
After removing a discount code, we refetch the cart to show updated prices. ### 📄 web/storefront/src/components/DiscountCodeBadge/DiscountCodeBadge.tsx ```tsx 18 await platform.discounts.removeDiscountCode(); 19 await refetchCart(); ```
> ⚠️ After we apply or remove a discount code, the `key` of discounted line items will change. If we did not refetch the cart then we would have an outdated `key` value which would cause errors if we tried to call `cart/update.js` or `cart/change.js`. # Limitations ## **Multiple** discount codes are not supported
### 📄 web/src/@templates/CartEditor/DiscountCodesModule/DiscountCodesModule.tsx ```tsx 50 Multiple discount codes are not supported. ```
### Why are multiple discount codes not supported? We cannot apply multiple discount codes because the way that we [apply a discount code](https://app.swimm.io/workspaces/3BezpZGfA5ijfn7Yn30j/repos/Z2l0aHViJTNBJTNBVXBDYXJ0LTIuMCUzQSUzQWJlYW0tY29tbWVyY2U=/docs/3vst4bcr#heading-27B5Pj) does not support multiple codes. This is the only way that we know of to apply a discount code from the storefront. We will have to wait for Shopify to add support for multiple codes or to find a different way to apply codes which does support multiple. If a customer applies two discount codes back to back, the first discount code will be discarded and only use the most recently applied code will affect the cart. ## Free shipping discounts are not supported
### 📄 web/src/@templates/CartEditor/DiscountCodesModule/DiscountCodesModule.tsx ```tsx 58 Free shipping discounts are not supported. ```
### Why are free shipping discounts not supported? We cannot apply free shipping discounts because the way that we [apply a discount code](https://app.swimm.io/workspaces/3BezpZGfA5ijfn7Yn30j/repos/Z2l0aHViJTNBJTNBVXBDYXJ0LTIuMCUzQSUzQWJlYW0tY29tbWVyY2U=/docs/3vst4bcr#heading-27B5Pj) does not support them. ## Shopify Plus stores using checkout.liquid are not supported
### 📄 web/src/@templates/CartEditor/DiscountCodesModule/DiscountCodesModule.tsx ```tsx 64 Shopify Plus stores using checkout.liquid are not supported. ```
### Why are Shopify Plus stores using checkout.liquid not supported? Historically, the Ajax API only included automatic discounts and did not include discount codes. Shopify changed this behaviour and started including discounts from discount codes in Ajax API responses. There are still some stores which do not include discount codes in Ajax API responses. The discount codes module does not work on these stores. ### How can we tell if a store is eligible? The Ajax API will include discount codes in responses only if the store is on Shopify's new checkout.
We can identify wether or not a store is on Shopify's new checkout by looking at the cart token. If the cart token is 32 characters long and only includes hex digits (0123456789abcdef) then the store is on Shopify's old checkout, otherwise it is on Shopify's new checkout and the Ajax API will include discount codes in responses. Stores that are on Shopify's new checkout may have different token formats. The following are examples that we've seen: - c1-d3f024e3af037f40bfe1b016b5b76f05 - Z2NwLXVzLWNlbnRyYWwxOjAxSEZFMjFIV1FZUFc0SlQ3Q00ySFFSSjgy ### 📄 web/storefront/src/platform/online-store/discounts/discounts.ts ```typescript 5 getStoreCanApplyDiscountCodesInCart({ cart }: { cart: Cart }): boolean { 6 if (!cart.token) return false; 7 const isLegacyCartToken = cart.token.match(/^[0-9a-f]{32}$/) !== null; 8 return !isLegacyCartToken; 9 } ```
### What happens if a store is not eligible?
If a store is not eligible then the discount code module will not be shown. ### 📄 web/storefront/src/modules/CartPopup/Cart.tsx ```tsx 499 {platform.discounts.getStoreCanApplyDiscountCodesInCart({ cart }) && 500 settings.upcartEditorSettings.discountCodeModule && ( 501 502 )} ```
In the preview we will show the discount code module even for stores that are not eligible. We do this because it would require a lot of work to check eligibility when not on the storefront. ### 📄 web/src/@templates/CartEditor/platform/preview/discounts/discounts.ts ```typescript 5 getStoreCanApplyDiscountCodesInCart(args: { cart: Cart }): boolean { 6 return true; 7 } ```

<html>
  <head>
    <title>UpCart Loading...</title>
    <script>
      /*
       * Constants
       */
      const INSTALL_SOURCE_QUERY_PARAM = 'via';
      const COOKIE_LIFETIME_MS = 3 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000; // 3 days
      const COOKIE_NAME = 'upcart_install_source';

      /*
       * 1. Get the ?via= query for the following steps
       */
      const installSource = encodeURIComponent(
        new URLSearchParams(window.location.search).get(INSTALL_SOURCE_QUERY_PARAM),
      );

      /*
       * 2. Set a cookie with the install source for 3 days so we can read it when they install the app
       */
      const cookieDomain = '.' + window.location.hostname;
      const cookieExpiresDate = new Date();
      cookieExpiresDate.setTime(cookieExpiresDate.getTime() + COOKIE_LIFETIME_MS);
      const cookieExpires = cookieExpiresDate.toGMTString();
      document.cookie = `${COOKIE_NAME}=${installSource}; expires=${cookieExpires}; domain=${cookieDomain}; path=/; SameSite=None; Secure`;

      /*
       * 3. Redirect to the app store, including the install source as a query param for App Store Google Analytics
       */
      window.location.replace(`https://apps.shopify.com/upcart-cart-builder?join-via=${installSource}`);
    </script>

# Security Policy

## Supported versions

### New features

New features will only be added to the master branch and will not be made available in point releases.

### Bug fixes

Only the latest release series will receive bug fixes. When enough bugs are fixed and its deemed worthy to release a new gem, this is the branch it happens from.

### Security issues

Only the latest release series will receive patches and new versions in case of a security issue.

### Severe security issues

For severe security issues we will provide new versions as above, and also the last major release series will receive patches and new versions. The classification of the security issue is judged by the core team.

### Unsupported Release Series

When a release series is no longer supported, it's your own responsibility to deal with bugs and security issues. If you are not comfortable maintaining your own versions, you should upgrade to a supported version.

## Reporting a bug

All security bugs in shopify repositories should be reported to [our hackerone program](https://hackerone.com/shopify)
Shopify's whitehat program is our way to reward security researchers for finding serious security vulnerabilities in the In Scope properties listed at the bottom of this page, including our core application (all functionality associated with a Shopify store, particularly your-store.myshopify.com/admin) and certain ancillary applications.

## Disclosure Policy

We look forward to working with all security researchers and strive to be respectful, always assume the best and treat others as peers. We expect the same in return from all participants. To achieve this, our team strives to:

- Reply to all reports within one business day and triage within two business days (if applicable)
- Be as transparent as possible, answering all inquires about our report decisions and adding hackers to duplicate HackerOne reports
- Award bounties within a week of resolution (excluding extenuating circumstances)
- Only close reports as N/A when the issue reported is included in Known Issues, Ineligible Vulnerabilities Types or lacks evidence of a vulnerability

**The following rules must be followed in order for any rewards to be paid:**

- You may only test against shops you have created which include your HackerOne YOURHANDLE @ wearehackerone.com registered email address.
- You must not attempt to gain access to, or interact with, any shops other than those created by you.
- The use of commercial scanners is prohibited (e.g., Nessus).
- Rules for reporting must be followed.
- Do not disclose any issues publicly before they have been resolved.
- Shopify reserves the right to modify the rules for this program or deem any submissions invalid at any time. Shopify may cancel the whitehat program without notice at any time.
- Contacting Shopify Support over chat, email or phone about your HackerOne report is not allowed. We may disqualify you from receiving a reward, or from participating in the program altogether.
- You are not an employee of Shopify; employees should report bugs to the internal bug bounty program.
- You hereby represent, warrant and covenant that any content you submit to Shopify is an original work of authorship and that you are legally entitled to grant the rights and privileges conveyed by these terms. You further represent, warrant and covenant that the consent of no other person or entity is or will be necessary for Shopify to use the submitted content.
- By submitting content to Shopify, you irrevocably waive all moral rights which you may have in the content.
- All content submitted by you to Shopify under this program is licensed under the MIT License.
- You must report any discovered vulnerability to Shopify as soon as you have validated the vulnerability.
- Failure to follow any of the foregoing rules will disqualify you from participating in this program.

** Please see our [Hackerone Profile](https://hackerone.com/shopify) for full details

## Receiving Security Updates

To recieve all general updates to vulnerabilities, please subscribe to our hackerone [Hacktivity](https://hackerone.com/shopify/hacktivity)

Follow the [instructions in this Notion document](https://www.notion.so/aftersell/Dev-Setup-11be2bf7ea6a4cad93acdae3fe4d8ca7?pvs=4) to setup the development environment for the Chrome extension.

# [[[ --- STAGE: BASE ENVIRONMENT SETUP --- ]]]
# see https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/37345#issuecomment-400250849
FROM node:18.16.1-alpine as base
# Accept command line '--build-arg' arguments
ARG PORT=8081
ARG HOST
ARG SHOPIFY_API_KEY
ARG INTERCOM_APP_ID
ARG SENTRY_SOURCE_MAP_UPLOAD_API_SECRET_KEY

# Copy command line args to env to use during build and for final image runtime
ENV PORT=${PORT} \
    HOST=${HOST} \
    SHOPIFY_API_KEY=${SHOPIFY_API_KEY} \
    INTERCOM_APP_ID=${INTERCOM_APP_ID}
    # ^^^^^ WARNING ^^^^^ do not include trailing "\" on the last line above, you will get a syntax error with a terrible error message
    #
    # SENTRY_SOURCE_MAP_UPLOAD_API_SECRET_KEY is intentionally not included here since it is only for building and shouldn't be available at runtime

# [[[ --- STAGE: BUILD --- ]]]
FROM base AS build
WORKDIR /app
COPY web/package.json web/yarn.lock ./web/
COPY web/patches ./web/patches
RUN yarn install --cwd web --frozen-lockfile --production=false
COPY . .
# NOTE: we need Sentry API token to upload source maps to Sentry during build, see withSentryConfig in next.config.js
RUN echo "[auth]\ntoken=${SENTRY_SOURCE_MAP_UPLOAD_API_SECRET_KEY}" > ./web/.sentryclirc
RUN yarn web:build

# [[[ --- STAGE: LICENSES WEB --- ]]]
FROM base AS licenses-web
WORKDIR /app
COPY web/package.json web/yarn.lock ./web/
RUN mkdir -p ./web/public/licenses/
RUN yarn licenses generate-disclaimer --prod --cwd web > ./web/public/licenses/web.txt

# [[[ --- STAGE: LICENSES STOREFRONT --- ]]]
FROM base AS licenses-storefront
WORKDIR /app
COPY web/storefront/package.json web/storefront/yarn.lock ./web/storefront/
RUN mkdir -p ./web/public/licenses/
RUN yarn licenses generate-disclaimer --prod --cwd web/storefront > ./web/public/licenses/storefront.txt

# [[[ --- STAGE: FINAL/RUNTIME --- ]]]
FROM base
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=build /app .
COPY package.json ./package.json
RUN yarn install --frozen-lockfile --production=true
COPY --from=licenses-web /app/web/public/licenses/web.txt ./web/public/licenses/web.txt
COPY --from=licenses-storefront /app/web/public/licenses/storefront.txt ./web/public/licenses/storefront.txt
CMD ["yarn", "web:start"]

# Getting Started with Create React App

This project was bootstrapped with [Create React App](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app).

## Available Scripts

In the project directory, you can run:

### `npm start`

Runs the app in the development mode.\
Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) to view it in the browser.

The page will reload if you make edits.\
You will also see any lint errors in the console.

### `npm test`

Launches the test runner in the interactive watch mode.\
See the section about [running tests](https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/running-tests) for more information.

### `npm run build`

Builds the app for production to the `build` folder.\
It correctly bundles React in production mode and optimizes the build for the best performance.

The build is minified and the filenames include the hashes.\
Your app is ready to be deployed!

See the section about [deployment](https://facebook.github.io/create-react-app/docs/deployment) for more information.

### `npm run eject`

**Note: this is a one-way operation. Once you `eject`, you can’t go back!**

If you aren’t satisfied with the build tool and configuration choices, you can `eject` at any time. This command will remove the single build dependency from your project.

Instead, it will copy all the configuration files and the transitive dependencies (webpack, Babel, ESLint, etc) right into your project so you have full control over them. All of the commands except `eject` will still work, but they will point to the copied scripts so you can tweak them. At this point you’re on your own.

You don’t have to ever use `eject`. The curated feature set is suitable for small and middle deployments, and you shouldn’t feel obligated to use this feature. However we understand that this tool wouldn’t be useful if you couldn’t customize it when you are ready for it.

chunk.takeaways: Dockerfile snippet provides insights into the multi-stage Docker setup for the project, including base environment setup, build stages, and final/runtime configurations. Key details include handling command line arguments, setting up environment variables, building the app, generating license disclaimers, and defining the runtime command.

snippet.code:
# [[[ --- STAGE: BASE ENVIRONMENT SETUP --- ]]]
# see https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/37345#issuecomment-400250849
FROM node:18.16.1-alpine as base
# Accept command line '--build-arg' arguments
ARG PORT=8081
ARG HOST
ARG SHOPIFY_API_KEY
ARG INTERCOM_APP_ID
ARG SENTRY_SOURCE_MAP_UPLOAD_API_SECRET_KEY

# Copy command line args to env to use during build and for final image runtime
ENV PORT=${PORT} \
    HOST=${HOST} \
    SHOPIFY_API_KEY=${SHOPIFY_API_KEY} \
    INTERCOM_APP_ID=${INTERCOM_APP_ID}
    # ^^^^^ WARNING ^^^^^ do not include trailing "\" on the last line above, you will get a syntax error with a terrible error message
    #
    # SENTRY_SOURCE_MAP_UPLOAD_API_SECRET_KEY is intentionally not included here since it is only for building and shouldn't be available at runtime

# [[[ --- STAGE: BUILD --- ]]]
FROM base AS build
WORKDIR /app
COPY web/package.json web/yarn.lock ./web/
COPY web/patches ./web/patches
RUN yarn install --cwd web --frozen-lockfile --production=false
COPY . .
# NOTE: we need Sentry API token to upload source maps to Sentry during build, see withSentryConfig in next.config.js
RUN echo "[auth]\ntoken=${SENTRY_SOURCE_MAP_UPLOAD_API_SECRET_KEY}" > ./web/.sentryclirc
RUN yarn web:build

# [[[ --- STAGE: LICENSES WEB --- ]]]
FROM base AS licenses-web
WORKDIR /app
COPY web/package.json web/yarn.lock ./web/
RUN mkdir -p ./web/public/licenses/
RUN yarn licenses generate-disclaimer --prod --cwd web > ./web/public/licenses/web.txt

# [[[ --- STAGE: LICENSES STOREFRONT --- ]]]
FROM base AS licenses-storefront
WORKDIR /app
COPY web/storefront/package.json web/storefront/yarn.lock ./web/storefront/
RUN mkdir -p ./web/public/licenses/
RUN yarn licenses generate-disclaimer --prod --cwd web/storefront > ./web/public/licenses/storefront.txt

# [[[ --- STAGE: FINAL/RUNTIME --- ]]]
FROM base
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=build /app .
COPY package.json ./package.json
RUN yarn install --frozen-lockfile --production=true
COPY --from=licenses-web /app/web/public/licenses/web.txt ./web/public/licenses/web.txt
COPY --from=licenses-storefront /app/web/public/licenses/storefront.txt ./web/public/licenses/storefront.txt
CMD ["yarn", "web:start"]
